text: Merci à Marc-André pour le partage! Dernière bière dune assez longue série. Robe bleue, mauve, violette, opaque, dense et sombre. Cest de toute beauté et sans aucune doute, très fruité et texturé. Intenses arômes de bleuets, de tarte aux fruits noirs, de bois légèrement vanillé et de funk sauvage. Cest la texture qui me plaît le plus dans cette bière. Le fruit est si présent et le liquide si dense, que je ressens de la pelure de bleuet. Cest presque râpeux. Forte présence de tanins de la barrique sans astringence toutefois. Funk lactique heureusement bien balancé par un fruit bien sucré. Lentement je saurais boire une bouteille entière seul; chose que je ne saurais faire pour tous les produits de cette brasserie. Loin de là.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a dark reddish purple with a very small pinkish head. Aroma of fruit and berries. Taste is blueberries, lemon, some wood, and some funk. Very tart, very tasty.
Ratebeer Best bottle share. Pours reddish brown with a cute pinkish head and a blueberry aroma. There is a sourish malt flavor with a tart finish.
Bottle. Pours deep reddish purple with no head. Aroma is blueberry jam. Taste is blueberry jam, blueberry tart, medium-high sourness, no funk.

750 ml bottle shared by urbancaver- thanks again, Cam! Pours a hazy magenta color, near purple, with a small white head that vanishes. Notes of blueberries, plums, lemon, florals, wheat, sourdough, funk, and tannins. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, fruity mouthfeel. Like most De Garde Berliners Ive had, theyre not the most complex but some of the tastiest - and thats kind of the point, isnt it?

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a taster showing moderately filtered blueberry blue with white foam lacing. 

The nose shows lightly tart but fruit forward notes of blueberry. 

The palate is light bodied and highly carbonated. Highly tart with blueberry forward flavors and a very lightly acetic finish. Perfectly balanced. Another beautiful de Garde beer.
Great share with the guys. Beautiful bluish purple hue with nary a head. Aromas of blueberry, funk. Gentle sweetness imparted from the fruit character. Absolutely delicious.
Bottle, light purple pour, highly carbonated. Aroma is funk and blueberries. Flavor is blueberries, finish is vinegar.

Bottle. Pours very hazy magenta, large white-pink head, fizzy and quick to dissipate, decent lacing. Aroma is funky, berries, sour mash. Flavor is medium tart, light plus funk, berries, sour mash, hints of oak tannins. Medium light body, high carbonation. Yum. Wife loved this one as well.

bottle shared by a friend. poured a deep light purple colour with a sprizzy non lasting white head. well, as you can expect from de garde standards, there is lots and i mean lots of blueberries, oak, tart, acidity, sprizzy lemons, mouthfeel is full of blueberry, wich is in my opinion, a bit to much, it really is tart, i do love me some tart beers, but this is jawbreaking tart. its a bit carbonated aswell, wich made it a bit unbalanced to me.
Pours a reddish purple with no head. Aroma of lacto, vinegar, red wine and blueberries. Taste follows, extremely acidic with moderate blueberry flavor.

Bottle shared in the line for Blåbær Release 2015. Pours a hazy pink with a big, off white head. Aroma has sour blueberries, funk, classic de garde-lactic and yeasty notes. Taste us very sour, but still very drinkable. Lovely, dirty organic fruit notes of blueberry and strawberry, Funky and delicious. High carbonation, light and citric body. Yes!
Bottle. Pours hazy, bright red with white head. Aroma is very berry, juicy, blueberry, vanilla. Taste is sour throughout, high carbonation, good flavor coming through. Overall, quite tasty.

why you always up in my shit!? .. blueberry for sure, but of the fresh tree variety .. thunder .. . mouth is prickly and satisfying .. de garde is awesome, im sorry if you feel odd about that but thats what i believe. that and Sasquatch!

Bottle sample in the Blåbær line courtesy of Burspak. Thanks man! Pours very hazy bluish red with a small bluish pinkish white head that leaves som trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity with crackers, cereal, lemon juice, blueberries, yoghurt, moist wood, hay, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is heavy sour and fruity. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, mouth-puckering, fruit skin astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is heavy sour with crackers, lemon juice, lime juice, blueberries, hay, dry soil and lemon zest. Very sour! That and the fruit skin astringency makes this rather hard to drink. Tasty nonetheless packed full with blueberries...

Bottle in line for blåbær. Thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy red with a white head. Aroma of yogurt, juicy blueberries, jammy, lactic tartness, oak and De gardeish. Thaste is lactic and tart with notes of blueberries and other sour berries along with some funk and jammy notes.
Bottle in line for Blåbær 15. Hazy reddish pour with some lacings. Loads of juicy blueberries, tannins, lactic notes and some tart notes.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy deep red. Aromas of blueberries, yoghurt, lactic tartness, lemon zest, light vinegar. Taste is blueberries, oaky, vanilla, yoghurt, a weird tomato sauce thing going on. Pretty good, but not as good as some of the other bus Ive had.
Blåbær street tasting 2015. Pours pink muddy with pink head. Aroma of blueberry artificiel, heavy oregano, herbs. Taste is sour blueberry, light herbs leading to a dry, latic finish, light wood.
Bottle at blåbær release 2015. Pinkish body with a small head. Blueberries, oak, tomato sauce on a pizza, tart, vinegar, oregano. Its quite weird, but good.
Purple pour, smaller head. Blueberry and oak aroma. Blueberry first and foremost in the taste, oak, lemon tartness, lactose sourness. Lively carbonation.
Bottle. Thanks Jake. Pours purple. Nose/taste of oak, blueberry, lactose, sour wheat - lighter medium body.
Bottle. Ruby purple with white head. Blueberries, tart aromas. Sweet and tart blueberries, other berries and general tart Flavors. Thanks de garde.
Bottle thanks to Tectactoe. Aroma is blueberries and vinegar. Tastes brings in strong wheat to go with the blueberry and vinegar. Moderately sour. Really good.

Courtesy of tectactoe
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate blueberry, lemon, yogurt, and funk. It pours hazy pinkish-brown with a small pinkish head that quickly fades to almost nothing. The flavor starts with a quick dose of blueberry. The finish has wheat, sour lemon, yogurt, funk, and must. Its light bodied with moderate-lively carbonation.

Draft at de Garde (2/15/15) - from notes. Beautiful ruby pour with pink head. Okay retention, no lacing. Blueberries ... are hard for me to appreciate in a beer I think, but Ill do my best. Aroma: Tannic, fruited blueberry tea. Herbal and medicinal. Moderately sweet; balanced by assertive tartness. Light body, average carbonation. My wife would prefer less funk, more blueberry. I can neither agree nor disagree. Overall: Sort of a spritzy blueberry pickle iced tea and tonic cocktail. Not my jam.

Beer pours cloudy blue with a nice head. Aroma of blackberry, blueberry, very intense blueberry with some semi clean barnyard funk. Taste follows up, deeply tart, yogurt lacto, very complex with vanilla and oak character bundled with a huge berry presence. This is very very fizzy, which seems to do wonders for the berry. A very good Berliner indeed.

Poured a purplish color with aromas of light oak, tart wheat, lactose and some blue berries. Flavors are blueberries, funk, tartness, lactose and very light on the palate. Really enjoyed this nice and refreshing.

(750ml bottle) bright pink with soda like carbonation. Nose of blueberry, very tart, touch of vinous smells. Taste of oak, wine barrel, tart blueberry, yogurt, other tart berries, soda-like carbonation, delicious tart linger.

Pours a lovely deep pink/purple with brilliant clarity and a persistent pink quilt. Really lovely. Smells strongly of blueberries and some raspberry character. Lots of funky oak and tart sharpness. Oh fuck yeah. Nice and tart and sharp while dumping loads of blueberries down my throat. Finish lasts long time and is enhanced by the parotid engorgement that wets my palate from the tartness. Thin bodied with high carb and a salivating finish. Goddammit, I only got one of these, wish I had gotten more.
Purple color. Pink head. Sour, juicy, berries, lactic sourness, yogurt, lemon, blackberry, cherry. Freaking awesome.

Amazing dense hazy pink/purple pour with zero head. Holy amazing awesome de Garde nose batman. Funky, cheesy, tillemooky funk rolls around with lie berries, both fresh and pie filling. The nose is fantastic. Hints of lemon, green bell pepper. Tart acetic up front. Malty medium body with a sticky end. Taste is thinner than expected. Taste is a muted version of the nose. Funky and fruity. Yeast, tillamook fresh air, egg funk lead to lemony blueberry goodness. Some fresh red pepper, fresh cut grass and zest. The nose is astounding, the taste is a bit less that is hoped.

Pinkish red, with no head. Smells like red wine and citrus, Taste is sour, oaky, winey. The blueberry is there, but in the background and adds a subtle flavor instead of dominating. Really Nice stuff. Thanks to grownfool for this one!

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy blue hue with fizzy reddish head that dissipated. Aroma is lactic, straw, blueberry, oak. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and sharp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness with a tart sourness throughout. Overall this is a very nice brew.
Bottle thanks to Phil. Pours a cloudy purple with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong blueberry, oak, funk. Thin mouthfeel with strong sourness, blueberry, oak, really enjoyed this.

Bottle from the brewery, courtesy Chris. Pours a translucent purple, just a hint of off-white head. Aroma fruity, with some lacto and a green woody character. Body medium-lively, with a well-balanced tartness, lots of fruit but a lingering tannic tang as well. One of the better BUs.
